meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a pore or pores
meanings.sent1: The poriferal structure of the sponge allows water to flow through easily.
meanings.sent2: Her skin had a poriferal texture, making it prone to clogging pores.
meanings.sent3: The poriferal nature of the sponge made it the perfect candidate for soaking up spills.
meanings.sent4: The poriferal quality of the fabric resembled a sieve, filtering out impurities.
meanings.sent5: The poriferal design of the building ensured good ventilation throughout.

meanings.definition: a small opening in a surface, especially the skin or a membrane
meanings.sent1: The tiny poriferal on the leaf allowed for gas exchange.
meanings.sent2: She noticed a poriferal on her hand where a splinter had been removed.
meanings.sent3: The poriferal in the fence was so small that even ants couldn't pass through.
meanings.sent4: The poriferal in the wall acted as a secret passage for the mice.
meanings.sent5: The poriferal in the balloon caused it to deflate slowly over time.
